intro: Dicellandra setosa, commonly known as the hairy dicellandra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that develops from the flower. Dicellandra setosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
